values.authorQuote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is liking what you get.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Don't work for recognition, but do work worthy of recognition.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Hope is the magic carpet that transports us from the present moment into the realm of infinite possibilities.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Talent without discipline is like an octopus on roller skates. There's plenty of movement, but you never know if it's going to be forward, backwards, or sideways.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Always kiss your children goodnight, even if they're already asleep.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Acquaintances we meet, enjoy, and can easily leave behind; but friendship grows deep roots.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Protect your enthusiasm from the negativity of others.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Watch your finances like a hawk.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Put a love note in his shaving kit before he leaves on a business trip.
values.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
values.authorOccupation: author of life's little instruction book

values.authorQuote: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: On some great and glorious day the plain folks of the land will reach their heart's desire at last, and the White House will be adorned by a downright moron.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: For every complex problem there is an answer that is clear, simple, and wrong.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: The most dangerous man to any government is the man who is able to think things out... without regard to the prevailing superstitions and taboos. Almost inevitably he comes to the conclusion that the government he lives under is dishonest, insane, intolerable.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: A judge is a law student who marks his own examination papers.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: In this world of sin and sorrow there is always something to be thankful for; as for me, I rejoice that I am not a Republican.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Puritanism. The haunting fear that someone, somewhere, may be happy.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: A bad man is the sort who weeps every time he speaks of a good woman.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Every man sees in his relatives, and especially in his cousins, a series of grotesque caricatures of himself.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Every election is a sort of advance auction sale of stolen goods.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: It is now quite lawful for a Catholic woman to avoid pregnancy by a resort to mathematics, though she is still forbidden to resort to physics or chemistry.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: It is not materialism that is the chief curse of the world, as pastors teach, but idealism. Men get into trouble by taking their visions and hallucinations too seriously.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: When a new source of taxation is found it never means, in practice, that the old source is abandoned. It merely means that the politicians have two ways of milking the taxpayer where they had one before.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: If a politician found he had cannibals among his constituents, he would promise them missionaries for dinner.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: I never lecture, not because I am shy or a bad speaker, but simply because I detest the sort of people who go to lectures and don't want to meet them.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: I confess I enjoy democracy immensely. It is incomparably idiotic, and hence incomparably amusing.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Have you ever watched a crab on the shore crawling backward in search of the Atlantic Ocean, and missing? That's the way the mind of man operates.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: Honor is simply the morality of superior men.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: In war the heroes always outnumber the soldiers ten to one.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: An idealist is one who, on noticing that roses smell better than a cabbage, concludes that it will also make better soup.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: It is even harder for the average ape to believe that he has descended from man.
values.author: H. L. Mencken

values.authorQuote: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Cats are the runes of beauty, invincibility, wonder, pride, freedom, coldness, self-sufficiency, and dainty individuality - the qualities of sensitive, enlightened, mentally developed, pagan, cynical, poetic, philosophic, dispassionate, reserved, independent, Nietzschean, unbroken, civilised, master-class men.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Unhappy is he to whom the memories of childhood bring only fear and sadness.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Children will always be afraid of the dark, and men with minds sensitive to hereditary impulse will always tremble at the thought of the hidden and fathomless worlds of strange life which may pulsate in the gulfs beyond the stars, or press hideously upon our own globe in unholy dimensions which only the dead and the moonstruck can glimpse.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Personally, I would not care for immortality in the least. There is nothing better than oblivion, since in oblivion there is no wish unfulfilled. We had it before we were born yet did not complain. Shall we whine because we know it will return? It is Elysium enough for me, at any rate.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: But more wonderful than the lore of old men and the lore of books is the secret lore of ocean.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: The most merciful thing in the world... is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: If religion were true, its followers would not try to bludgeon their young into an artificial conformity; but would merely insist on their unbending quest for truth, irrespective of artificial backgrounds or practical consequences.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: What a man does for pay is of little significance. What he is, as a sensitive instrument responsive to the world's beauty, is everything!
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: In theory I am an agnostic, but pending the appearance of rational evidence, I must be classed, practically and provisionally, as an atheist.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: All rationalism tends to minimalise the value and the importance of life and to decrease the sum total of human happiness.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: The cat is such a perfect symbol of beauty and superiority that it seems scarcely possible for any true aesthete and civilised cynic to do other than worship it.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Toil without song is like a weary journey without an end.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Searchers after horror haunt strange, far places.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: To the scientist there is the joy in pursuing truth which nearly counteracts the depressing revelations of truth.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: If I could create an ideal world, it would be an England with the fire of the Elizabethans, the correct taste of the Georgians, and the refinement and pure ideals of the Victorians.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: We shall see that at which dogs howl in the dark, and that at which cats prick up their ears after midnight.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: I am disillusioned enough to know that no man's opinion on any subject is worth a damn unless backed up with enough genuine information to make him really know what he's talking about.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: But are not the dreams of poets and the tales of travellers notoriously false?
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: I never ask a man what his business is, for it never interests me. What I ask him about are his thoughts and dreams.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: I could not write about 'ordinary people' because I am not in the least interested in them.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Of our relation to all creation we can never know anything whatsoever. All is immensity and chaos. But, since all this knowledge of our limitations cannot possibly be of any value to us, it is better to ignore it in our daily conduct of life.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Imagination is a very potent thing, and in the uneducated often usurps the place of genuine experience.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Very few minds are strictly normal, and all religious fanatics are marked with abnormalities of various sorts.
values.author: H. P. Lovecraft
values.authorOccupation: Short story writer, editor, novelist, poet

values.authorQuote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Now I've been free, I know what a dreadful condition slavery is. I have seen hundreds of escaped slaves, but I never saw one who was willing to go back and be a slave.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I was the conductor of the Underground Railroad for eight years, and I can say what most conductors can't say; I never ran my train off the track and I never lost a passenger.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I had crossed the line. I was free; but there was no one to welcome me to the land of freedom. I was a stranger in a strange land.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I had reasoned this out in my mind, there was one of two things I had a right to, liberty or death; if I could not have one, I would have the other.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: You'll be free or die!
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I looked at my hands to see if I was the same person. There was such a glory over everything. The sun came up like gold through the trees, and I felt like I was in heaven.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Never wound a snake; kill it.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I would fight for my liberty so long as my strength lasted, and if the time came for me to go, the Lord would let them take me.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I think slavery is the next thing to hell. If a person would send another into bondage, he would, it appears to me, be bad enough to send him into hell if he could.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I grew up like a neglected weed - ignorant of liberty, having no experience of it.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: In my dreams and visions, I seemed to see a line, and on the other side of that line were green fields, and lovely flowers, and beautiful white ladies, who stretched out their arms to me over the line, but I couldn't reach them no-how. I always fell before I got to the line.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I've heard 'Uncle Tom's Cabin' read, and I tell you Mrs. Stowe's pen hasn't begun to paint what slavery is as I have seen it at the far South. I've seen de real thing, and I don't want to see it on no stage or in no theater.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Twasn't me, 'twas the Lord! I always told Him, 'I trust to you. I don't know where to go or what to do, but I expect You to lead me,' an' He always did.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I can't die but once.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Most of those coming from the mainland are very destitute, almost naked. I am trying to find places for those able to work, and provide for them as best I can, so as to lighten the burden on the Government as much as possible, while at the same time they learn to respect themselves by earning their own living.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: 'Pears like my heart go flutter, flutter, and then they may say, 'Peace, Peace,' as much as they likes - I know it's goin' to be war!
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Why, der language down dar in de far South is jus' as different from ours in Maryland, as you can think. Dey laughed when dey heard me talk, an' I could not understand 'dem, no how.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I said to de Lord, 'I'm goin' to hold steady on to you, an' I know you'll see me through.'
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I think there's many a slaveholder'll get to Heaven. They don't know better. They acts up to the light they have.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Quakers almost as good as colored. They call themselves friends and you can trust them every time.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: I never had anything good, no sweet, no sugar; and that sugar, right by me, did look so nice, and my mistress's back was turned to me while she was fighting with her husband, so I just put my fingers in the sugar bowl to take one lump, and maybe she heard me, for she turned and saw me. The next minute, she had the rawhide down.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Lord, I'm going to hold steady on to You and You've got to see me through.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: Read my letter to the old folks, and give my love to them, and tell my brothers to be always watching unto prayer, and when the good old ship of Zion comes along, to be ready to step aboard.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: As I lay so sick on my bed, from Christmas till March, I was always praying for poor ole master. 'Pears like I didn't do nothing but pray for ole master. 'Oh, Lord, convert ole master;' 'Oh, dear Lord, change dat man's heart, and make him a Christian.'
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: 'Pears like I prayed all the time, 'bout my work, everywhere, I prayed an' groaned to the Lord.
values.author: Harriet Tubman
values.authorOccupation: Civil War Nurse, Suffragist, Civil Rights activist

values.authorQuote: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: You want a friend in Washington? Get a dog.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: There is nothing new in the world except the history you do not know.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: Actions are the seed of fate deeds grow into destiny.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: The reward of suffering is experience.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: In reading the lives of great men, I found that the first victory they won was over themselves... self-discipline with all of them came first.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: You can never get all the facts from just one newspaper, and unless you have all the facts, you cannot make proper judgements about what is going on.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: Carry the battle to them. Don't let them bring it to you. Put them on the defensive and don't ever apologize for anything.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: If you can't stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: It is understanding that gives us an ability to have peace. When we understand the other fellow's viewpoint, and he understands ours, then we can sit down and work out our differences.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: I do not believe there is a problem in this country or the world today which could not be settled if approached through the teaching of the Sermon on the Mount.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: The atom bomb was no 'great decision.' It was merely another powerful weapon in the arsenal of righteousness.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: If I'd known how much packing I'd have to do, I'd have run again.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: If you can't convince them, confuse them.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: I never did give anybody hell. I just told the truth and they thought it was hell.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: Those who want the Government to regulate matters of the mind and spirit are like men who are so afraid of being murdered that they commit suicide to avoid assassination.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: A leader in the Democratic Party is a boss, in the Republican Party he is a leader.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: When you get to be President, there are all those things, the honors, the twenty-one gun salutes, all those things. You have to remember it isn't for you. It's for the Presidency.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: All the president is, is a glorified public relations man who spends his time flattering, kissing, and kicking people to get them to do what they are supposed to do anyway.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: You know that being an American is more than a matter of where your parents came from. It is a belief that all men are created free and equal and that everyone deserves an even break.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: The President is always abused. If he isn't, he isn't doing anything.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: A President cannot always be popular.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: The United Nations is designed to make possible lasting freedom and independence for all its members.
values.author: Harry S Truman

values.authorQuote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: The highest result of education is tolerance.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: So long as the memory of certain beloved friends lives in my heart, I shall say that life is good.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched, they must be felt with the heart.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: What I am looking for is not out there, it is in me.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Life is an exciting business, and most exciting when it is lived for others.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Literature is my Utopia. Here I am not disenfranchised. No barrier of the senses shuts me out from the sweet, gracious discourses of my book friends. They talk to me without embarrassment or awkwardness.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: We can do anything we want to if we stick to it long enough.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Knowledge is love and light and vision.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Until the great mass of the people shall be filled with the sense of responsibility for each other's welfare, social justice can never be attained.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
values.author: Helen Keller

values.authorQuote: I think my mouth just opens and I spontaneously say things that occur to me.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I love witches and magic and dress-up and make-believe.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: You learn to rely on a few basic movements and use your voice to the greatest extent possible to convey your emotions. So there was a technical challenge there and a responsibility to create a character from behind the mask.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: When you're up for an Oscar, you just get offered everything. It's fantastic, but a lot of it you're completely inappropriate for.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: All the ancient classic fairy tales have always been scary and dark.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: Journalists are always calling my features Edwardian or Victorian, whatever that means. I am small, and people were smaller in those times. I'm pale and sickly-looking. I look fragile-like a doll. But sometimes I just wish I had less of a particular look, one that was more versatile.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: Everybody has an inferiority complex when they step into a room. But then when you have children and you get older, it doesn't really matter. When I was young I had so many inferiority complexes. I had an inferiority complex because I didn't go to university. I had an inferiority complex because I didn't train.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I've got Tourette's, practically. I'll tell anyone anything.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: There is no normality in life.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I was a mixture of being incredibly old for my age and incredibly backwards. I was born quite old, but then I stopped growing. I lived with my mum and dad till I was 30.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I would pretend to be the French lieutenant's woman. I was always a romantic. I still am, actually.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: People say, 'You're still breast-feeding, that's so generous.' Generous, no! It gives me boobs and it takes my thighs away! It's sort of like natural liposuction. I'd carry on breast-feeding for the rest of my life if I could.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: It was weird because I was pregnant, throughout that so it was weird being a pregnant witch. I was in a really bad mood but luckily, because I sleep with the director, he just sort of scheduled me so I only had to do it two nights.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I also get fed up with the fact that casting agents and directors have this impression of me as being frail and petite. I find it very patronizing. I'm quite beefy and strong. I was a gymnast in school and I have lots of muscles.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I drink booze, I smoke, and I'm hooked on caffeine. I actually have been known to swear at times and belch and even raise my voice when provoked. And I'm not physically repressed!
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I have to struggle to change people's perceptions of me. I grew very frustrated with the perception that I'm this shy, retiring, inhibited aristocratic creature when I'm absolutely not like that at all. I think I'm much more outgoing and exuberant than my image.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I was weird right from the start. It's just that you can't ever expect people to get you. And I do think that really did mess with my head, being well-known young, when you really don't know who you are.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I liked pretending to be other people: I could reinvent myself, reinvent my own reality.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: A film actor is just a victim of directors and editors.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: Fairytales have always got to have that scary quality, as long as you make them laugh.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I think smells, like sounds, can be so much immediately affecting.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: My life had been very work-orientated, and all in close-up. Once I had the family, it went into sudden widescreen.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: In any relationship, after the first year is over, you can't help but want your own space.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I'm always attracted to lower budget, not because it's lower budget, but because they tend to be better scripts. It's the scripts that tend to be the small arthouse film that tend to be more actor-led and character driven.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I was sad that Corpse Bride was so short. I would've liked to have had her around for way longer. She doesn't actually have that many scenes.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: People have lots of misconceptions about me. My mum, who is half French and half Spanish, gets outraged when I'm called quintessentially English. I owe my looks to my mum-which was 90 percent of getting my first job. And, some people would argue, 90 percent of my entire career.
values.author: Helena Bonham Carter

values.authorQuote: I told the doctor I broke my leg in two places. He told me to quit going to those places.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: Some people ask the secret of our long marriage. We take time to go to a restaurant two times a week. A little candlelight, dinner, soft music and dancing. She goes Tuesdays, I go Fridays.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: If at first you don't succeed... so much for skydiving.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: When God sneezed, I didn't know what to say.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: When I read about the evils of drinking, I gave up reading.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: Do you know what it means to come home at night to a woman who'll give you a little love, a little affection, a little tenderness? It means you're in the wrong house, that's what it means.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: Just got back from a pleasure trip: I took my mother-in-law to the airport.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: A Jewish woman had two chickens. One got sick, so the woman made chicken soup out of the other one to help the sick one get well.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: I've been in love with the same woman for forty-one years. If my wife finds out, she'll kill me.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: While playing golf today I hit two good balls. I stepped on a rake.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: My wife dresses to kill. She cooks the same way.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: There was a girl knocking on my hotel room door all night! Finally, I let her out.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: My other brother-in-law died. He was a karate expert, then joined the army. The first time he saluted, he killed himself.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: You can't buy love, but you can pay heavily for it.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: A doctor gave a man six months to live. The man couldn't pay his bill, so he gave him another six months.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: The horse I bet on was so slow, the jockey kept a diary of the trip.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: Those two are a fastidious couple. She's fast and he's hideous.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: She's been married so many times she has rice marks on her face.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: How to drive a guy crazy: send him a telegram and on the top put 'page 2.'
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: If my mother knew I did this for a living, she'd kill me. She thinks I'm selling dope.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: My son complains about headaches. I tell him all the time, when you get out of bed, it's feet first!
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: She's a big-hearted girl with hips to match.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: This man is frank and earnest with women. In Fresno, he's Frank and in Chicago he's Ernest.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: Why do Jewish divorces cost so much? They're worth it.
values.author: Henny Youngman

values.authorQuote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Each day holds a surprise. But only if we expect it can we see, hear, or feel it when it comes to us. Let's not be afraid to receive each day's surprise, whether it comes to us as sorrow or as joy It will open a new place in our hearts, a place where we can welcome new friends and celebrate more fully our shared humanity.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.

values.authorQuote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Perhaps nothing helps us make the movement from our little selves to a larger world than remembering God in gratitude. Such a perspective puts God in view in all of life, not just in the moments we set aside for worship or spiritual disciplines. Not just in the moments when life seems easy.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: If fear is the great enemy of intimacy, love is its true friend.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: To learn patience is not to rebel against every hardship.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Solitude is very different from a 'time-out' from our busy lives. Solitude is the very ground from which community grows. Whenever we pray alone, study, read, write, or simply spend quiet time away from the places where we interact with each other directly, we are potentially opened for a deeper intimacy with each other.

values.authorQuote: The fruits of your labors may be reaped two generations from now. Trust, even when you don't see the results.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Intimacy is not a happy medium. It is a way of being in which the tension between distance and closeness is dissolved and a new horizon appears. Intimacy is beyond fear.

values.authorQuote: Spiritual identity means we are not what we do or what people say about us. And we are not what we have. We are the beloved daughters and sons of God.

values.authorQuote: The greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity or power, but self-rejection.

values.authorQuote: I have an increasing sense that the most important crisis of our time is spiritual and that we need places where people can grow stronger in the spirit and be able to integrate the emotional struggles in their spiritual journeys.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Our inclination is to show our Lord only what we feel comfortable with. But the more we dare to reveal our whole trembling self to him, the more we will be able to sense that his love, which is perfect love, casts out all our fears.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Peacemaking is a full-time vocation that includes each member of God's people.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: Prayer is the most concrete way to make our home in God.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: One of the most beautiful ways for spiritual formation to take place is to let your insecurity lead you closer to the Lord. Natural hypersensitivity can become an asset; it makes you aware of your need to be with people and it allows you to be more willing to look at their needs.

values.authorQuote: People with handicaps teach me that being is more important than doing, the heart is more important than the mind, and caring together is better than caring alone.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: In their poverty, the mentally handicapped reveal God to us and hold us close to the gospel.

values.authorQuote: Jesus didn't say, 'Blessed are those who care for the poor.' He said, 'Blessed are we where we are poor, where we are broken.' It is there that God loves us deeply and pulls us into deeper communion with himself.

values.authorQuote: Ministry is the least important thing. You cannot not minister if you are in communion with God and live in community.

values.authorQuote: Friendship has always belonged to the core of my spiritual journey.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: For Jesus, there are no countries to be conquered, no ideologies to be imposed, no people to be dominated. There are only children, women and men to be loved.

values.authorQuote: The discipline of gratitude is the explicit effort to acknowledge that all I am and have is given to me as a gift of love, a gift to be celebrated with joy.

values.authorQuote: God is a God of the present. God is always in the moment, be that moment hard or easy, joyful and painful.
values.author: Henri Nouwen

values.authorQuote: The spiritual life is not a life before, after, or beyond our everyday existence. No, the spiritual life can only be real when it is lived in the midst of the pains and joys of the here and now.

values.authorQuote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.

values.authorQuote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.

values.authorQuote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.

values.authorQuote: As a single footstep will not make a path on the earth, so a single thought will not make a pathway in the mind. To make a deep physical path, we walk again and again. To make a deep mental path, we must think over and over the kind of thoughts we wish to dominate our lives.

values.authorQuote: I am a woman above everything else.

values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: Now, I think that I should have known that he was magic all along. I did know it - but I should have guessed that it would be too much to ask to grow old with and see our children grow up together. So now, he is a legend when he would have preferred to be a man.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: The children have been a wonderful gift to me, and I'm thankful to have once again seen our world through their eyes. They restore my faith in the family's future.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: He didn't even have the satisfaction of being killed for civil rights. it had to be some silly little Communist.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: You have to have been a Republican to know how good it is to be a Democrat.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I always wanted to be some kind of writer or newspaper reporter. But after college... I did other things.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: An Editor becomes kind of your mother. You expect love and encouragement from an Editor.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I'm not concerned with your liking or disliking me... All I ask is that you respect me as a human being.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: There's not an American in this country free until every one of us is free.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The way I figured it, I was even with baseball and baseball with me. The game had done much for me, and I had done much for it.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The most luxurious possession, the richest treasure anybody has, is his personal dignity.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Life is not a spectator sport. If you're going to spend your whole life in the grandstand just watching what goes on, in my opinion you're wasting your life.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Baseball is like a poker game. Nobody wants to quit when he's losing; nobody wants you to quit when you're ahead.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Many people resented my impatience and honesty, but I never cared about acceptance as much as I cared about respect.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Today, Negroes play on every big league club and in every minor league. With millions of other Negroes in other walks of life, we are willing to stand up and be counted for what we believe in. In baseball or out, we are no longer willing to wait until Judgment Day for equality - we want it here on earth as well as in Heaven.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The right of every American to first-class citizenship is the most important issue of our time.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I speak to you only as an American who happens to be an American Negro and one who is proud of that heritage. We ask for nothing special. We ask only that we be permitted to compete on an even basis, and if we are not worthy, then the competition shall, per se, eliminate us.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: This ain't fun. But you watch me, I'll get it done.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: It kills me to lose. If I'm a troublemaker, and I don't think that my temper makes me one, then it's because I can't stand losing. That's the way I am about winning, all I ever wanted to do was finish first.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Above anything else, I hate to lose.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Pop flies, in a sense, are just a diversion for a second baseman. Grounders are his stock trade.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: How you played in yesterday's game is all that counts.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: After two years at UCLA, I decided to leave. I was convinced that no amount of education would help a black man get a job.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I guess you'd call me an independent, since I've never identified myself with one party or another in politics. I always decide my vote by taking as careful a look as I can at the actual candidates and issues themselves, no matter what the party label.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: In all my years of baseball, I have always expected to be traded. I never liked the idea.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: A new breed of Republicans has taken over the GOP. It is a new breed which is seeking to sell to Americans a doctrine which is as old as mankind - the doctrine of racial division, the doctrine of racial prejudice, the doctrine of white supremacy.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I cannot salute the flag; I know that I am a black man in a white world. In 1972, in 1947, at my birth in 1919, I know that I never had it made.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I want everybody to understand that I am an American Negro first before I am a member of any political party.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: It would make everything I worked for meaningless if baseball is integrated but political parties were segregated.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I cannot possibly believe that I have it made while so many black brothers and sisters are hungry, inadequately housed, insufficiently clothed, denied their dignity as they live in slums or barely exist on welfare.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The old Dodgers were something special, but of my teammates overall, there was nobody like Pee Wee Reese for me.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I think if we go back and check our record, the Negro has proven beyond a doubt that we have been more than patient in seeking our rights as American citizens.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The happiness of the bee and the dolphin is to exist. For man it is to know that and to wonder at it.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: Water and air, the two essential fluids on which all life depends, have become global garbage cans.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The real cure for our environmental problems is to understand that our job is to salvage Mother Nature. We are facing a formidable enemy in this field. It is the hunters... and to convince them to leave their guns on the wall is going to be very difficult.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: When one man, for whatever reason, has the opportunity to lead an extraordinary life, he has no right to keep it to himself.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: People protect what they love.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: However fragmented the world, however intense the national rivalries, it is an inexorable fact that we become more interdependent every day.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The sea, the great unifier, is man's only hope. Now, as never before, the old phrase has a literal meaning: we are all in the same boat.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: From birth, man carries the weight of gravity on his shoulders. He is bolted to earth. But man has only to sink beneath the surface and he is free.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: A lot of people attack the sea, I make love to it.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: What is a scientist after all? It is a curious man looking through a keyhole, the keyhole of nature, trying to know what's going on.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: We forget that the water cycle and the life cycle are one.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: If we go on the way we have, the fault is our greed and if we are not willing to change, we will disappear from the face of the globe, to be replaced by the insect.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: No sooner does man discover intelligence than he tries to involve it in his own stupidity.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The awareness of our environment came progressively in all countries with different outlets.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The sea is the universal sewer.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: No aquarium, no tank in a marine land, however spacious it may be, can begin to duplicate the conditions of the sea. And no dolphin who inhabits one of those aquariums or one of those marine lands can be considered normal.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: It takes generosity to discover the whole through others. If you realize you are only a violin, you can open yourself up to the world by playing your role in the concert.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: Man, of all the animals, is probably the only one to regard himself as a great delicacy.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The road to the future leads us smack into the wall. We simply ricochet off the alternatives that destiny offers. Our survival is no more than a question of 25, 50 or perhaps 100 years.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: Farming as we do it is hunting, and in the sea we act like barbarians.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: We must plant the sea and herd its animals using the sea as farmers instead of hunters. That is what civilization is all about - farming replacing hunting.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: If we were logical, the future would be bleak, indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings, and we have faith, and we have hope, and we can work.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: I believe that national sovereignties will shrink in the face of universal interdependence.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: I am not a scientist. I am, rather, an impresario of scientists.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The biggest obstacle was mixing abortion with overpopulation. These are two things that have nothing to do with each other.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: I love America more than any other country in this world, and, exactly for this reason, I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: It is certain, in any case, that ignorance, allied with power, is the most ferocious enemy justice can have.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The paradox of education is precisely this - that as one begins to become conscious one begins to examine the society in which he is being educated.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The most dangerous creation of any society is the man who has nothing to lose.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves that he isn't a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Everybody's journey is individual. If you fall in love with a boy, you fall in love with a boy. The fact that many Americans consider it a disease says more about them than it does about homosexuality.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: To be a Negro in this country and to be relatively conscious is to be in a rage almost all the time.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The power of the white world is threatened whenever a black man refuses to accept the white world's definitions.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: To act is to be committed, and to be committed is to be in danger.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The world is before you and you need not take it or leave it as it was when you came in.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: People are trapped in history and history is trapped in them.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Nobody is more dangerous than he who imagines himself pure in heart; for his purity, by definition, is unassailable.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Anyone who has ever struggled with poverty knows how extremely expensive it is to be poor.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Those who say it can't be done are usually interrupted by others doing it.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Fires can't be made with dead embers, nor can enthusiasm be stirred by spiritless men. Enthusiasm in our daily work lightens effort and turns even labor into pleasant tasks.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Love him and let him love you. Do you think anything else under heaven really matters?
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Be careful what you set your heart upon - for it will surely be yours.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: People can cry much easier than they can change.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: I am what time, circumstance, history, have made of me, certainly, but I am also, much more than that. So are we all.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: There is never time in the future in which we will work out our salvation. The challenge is in the moment; the time is always now.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The questions which one asks oneself begin, at least, to illuminate the world, and become one's key to the experience of others.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Education is indoctrination if you're white - subjugation if you're black.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The actions of men are the best interpreters of their thoughts.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: I asked him with my eyes to ask again yes and then he asked me would I yes to say yes my mountain flower and first I put my arms around him yes and drew him down to me so he could feel my breasts all perfume yes and his heart was going like mad and yes I said yes I will Yes.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: No pen, no ink, no table, no room, no time, no quiet, no inclination.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: I am tomorrow, or some future day, what I establish today. I am today what I established yesterday or some previous day.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: The men that is now is only all palaver and what they can get out of you.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: He found in the world without as actual what was in his world within as possible.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: I fear those big words which make us so unhappy.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: When I die Dublin will be written in my heart.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: A man of genius makes no mistakes; his errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: I've put in so many enigmas and puzzles that it will keep the professors busy for centuries arguing over what I meant, and that's the only way of insuring one's immortality.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: A nation is the same people living in the same place.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Better pass boldly into that other world, in the full glory of some passion, than fade and wither dismally with age.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Ireland is the old sow that eats her farrow.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Poetry, even when apparently most fantastic, is always a revolt against artifice, a revolt, in a sense, against actuality.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: The artist, like the God of the creation, remains within or behind or beyond or above his handiwork, invisible, refined out of existence, indifferent, paring his fingernails.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Men are governed by lines of intellect - women: by curves of emotion.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Shakespeare is the happy hunting ground of all minds that have lost their balance.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Nations have their ego, just like individuals.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Ireland sober is Ireland stiff.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: There is no heresy or no philosophy which is so abhorrent to the church as a human being.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: I think a child should be allowed to take his father's or mother's name at will on coming of age. Paternity is a legal fiction.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Whatever else is unsure in this stinking dunghill of a world a mother's love is not.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Your battles inspired me - not the obvious material battles but those that were fought and won behind your forehead.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Writing in English is the most ingenious torture ever devised for sins committed in previous lives. The English reading public explains the reason why.
values.author: James Joyce

values.authorQuote: Liberty may be endangered by the abuse of liberty, but also by the abuse of power.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: What is government itself but the greatest of all reflections on human nature? If men were angels, no government would be necessary. If angels were to govern men, neither external nor internal controls on government would be necessary.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: If men were angels, no government would be necessary.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Knowledge will forever govern ignorance; and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The happy Union of these States is a wonder; their Constitution a miracle; their example the hope of Liberty throughout the world.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: If Tyranny and Oppression come to this land, it will be in the guise of fighting a foreign enemy.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: What spectacle can be more edifying or more seasonable, than that of Liberty and Learning, each leaning on the other for their mutual and surest support?
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The purpose of separation of church and state is to keep forever from these shores the ceaseless strife that has soaked the soil of Europe with blood for centuries.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The truth is that all men having power ought to be mistrusted.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: In Republics, the great danger is, that the majority may not sufficiently respect the rights of the minority.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The advancement and diffusion of knowledge is the only guardian of true liberty.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: I believe there are more instances of the abridgement of freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments by those in power than by violent and sudden usurpations.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: A well regulated militia, composed of the body of the people, trained in arms, is the best most natural defense of a free country.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: A well-instructed people alone can be permanently a free people.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: As long as the reason of man continues fallible, and he is at liberty to exercise it, different opinions will be formed.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: It is a universal truth that the loss of liberty at home is to be charged to the provisions against danger, real or pretended, from abroad.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Of all the enemies of public liberty, war is perhaps the most to be dreaded, because it comprises and develops the germ of every other.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Americans have the right and advantage of being armed - unlike the citizens of other countries whose governments are afraid to trust the people with arms.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The capacity of the female mind for studies of the highest order cannot be doubted, having been sufficiently illustrated by its works of genius, of erudition, and of science.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: A popular government without popular information or the means of acquiring it, is but a prologue to a farce, or a tragedy, or perhaps both.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: America was indebted to immigration for her settlement and prosperity. That part of America which had encouraged them most had advanced most rapidly in population, agriculture and the arts.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: A sincere and steadfast co-operation in promoting such a reconstruction of our political system as would provide for the permanent liberty and happiness of the United States.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: War contains so much folly, as well as wickedness, that much is to be hoped from the progress of reason.
values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: We are right to take alarm at the first experiment upon our liberties.
values.author: James Madison

values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The personal right to acquire property, which is a natural right, gives to property, when acquired, a right to protection, as a social right.

values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.author: James Madison
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, U.S. Founding Father
values.authorBirthplace: Port Conway, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
